name: Golden Suisse
content: Golden Suisse operates similarly to traditional Swiss gold banks of the 19th century. Client deposits and investments are physical gold bars and bullion currencies.Our award-winning banking patented technology allows our clients to utilize their own personal gold  stored in Switzerland to make payments, transfers, and credit card purchases from any location across the globe.As a result, we are more secure than any private bank in the world, including by standards set out by the Bank of International Settlement, and  furthermore as we deal with gold we are also free from inflation risks.

name: Mauricio Mora Caballero
content: La facilidad con que las herramientas analíticas permiten que cada vez más personas ejecuten procedimientos es impresionante👍👍Reduciendo la brecha de conocimiento y facilitando la implementación de cualquier tipo de modelo👍👍Sin embargo, existen procedimientos estadísticos (regresión lineal, regresión logística binaria, múltiple, análisis discriminante...) que necesitan 👀validar supuestos para que sea correcto su uso👀Si no se cumplen estos supuestos, tenemos una ecuación muy linda que no tiene fundamento matemático y no puede usarse😭. Es importante que sepamos cuales son y cómo se deben probar, más allá de ejecutar el modelo y usarlo😃En las regresiones lineales, se debe validar antes de ejecutar el modelo:1. La cantidad de variables que se usen como independientes no puede ser más que la cantidad de registros2. Las variables independientes no deben estar correlacionadas entre sí (ausencia de Multicolinealidad)3. Los errores son idd (independientes e idénticamente distribuidos) con distribución normal con media cero y varianza constante.En siguientes publicaciones quiero 🔎indagar🔍 un poco más en cómo se deben validar los supuestos de los modelos estadísticosDar sugerencia de modelos (variaciones) que pueden tener el mismo alcance cuando no se cumplen los supuestos👍👍.Por ejemplo, al tener variables independientes correlacionados❕❕ se desarrollaron estrategias de regularización, creando variaciones de la regresión lineal conocidas como Lasso, Ridge o Elastic Net. En tu caso, estas probando los supuestos de las regresiones lineales❔❔ lo estás haciendo de forma correcta❔❔Si quieres saber más de estos temas, no dudes en escribirme❕❕#analítica #analisisdedatos #regresion #regresionlineal #supuestos #lasso #ridge #elasticnet #error #estadistica #modelos

name: Carlos L. Guardiola Ortuño
content: ¿Alguna vez te has preguntado…🔬 … hasta qué punto es real que podamos alterar las capacidades del ser humano a través de la tecnología? Entonces, ¿cuál es el papel de la tecnología y quién tiene que tomar las decisiones?🐒 Si los avances de la tecnología son intencionales y por tanto están dirigidos ¿significa el transhumanismo que seremos la primera especie que va a evolucionar por diseño?⛓ ¿Cómo van a coexistir las diferentes especies de humanos y transhumanos en el mismo lugar y al mismo tiempo? ¿Estaremos creando una nueva forma de desigualdad? ¿De discriminación? ¿De esclavitud?🌍 ¿Y qué pasa con la Tierra? ¿Qué recursos tenemos que explotar para construir el siguiente estado evolutivo del ser humano, y qué recursos vamos a tener que consumir para mantenerlo? ¿Es la colonización del espacio la respuesta? ⚰ ¿En qué momento vamos a alcanzar la inmortalidad? ¿Debemos alcanzarla? Hace más de 4.000 años se escribió el viaje de Gilgamesh en busca de la inmortalidad. Hoy, científicos como Ray Kurzweil predicen que el ser humano logrará la inmortalidad en el año 2030..Huxley acuñó el concepto de "transhumanismo" para reflejar la idea de que la humanidad debía usar la ciencia y la tecnología para mejorar las capacidades y superar nuestras limitaciones biológicas.More va más allá de la visión del transhumanismo como continuación natural del proceso de evolución, considera que el ser humano tiene la capacidad y la responsabilidad de mejorar su propia naturaleza biológica y mental.Otros como Bostrom son partidarios de la idea del "mejoramiento moral", que propone que la tecnología puede ser utilizada para mejorar las capacidades morales y éticas de los seres humanos.Y por último, Clark considera que desde hace décadas el ser humano han utilizado la tecnología para reemplazar o potenciar sus habilidades físicas, y que el reto del transhumanismo es la extensión de las capacidades cognitivas del ser humano.El jueves 18 de mayo hablamos de Transhumanismo con Isabel Fernández Peñuelas licenciada en Filosofía y especialista en Lógica, Filosofía de la Ciencia e Inteligencia Artificial. Después de una carrera de 30 años vinculada a la Innovación en empresas como Atos, FatWire y Oracle, ha fundado The Futures Factory, un estudio de prospectiva estratégica.En fin. Que mientras no podamos reunirnos telepáticamente, tendremos que seguir con aforo reducido, así es la vida 🤷‍♂️ Aquí las entradas

name: Button School
content: 📚 Enhance your Design Systems Skills: Expert Tips for Organizing Your Library! 🎨Are you looking to level up your design systems expertise? Exciting news! We're here to help you supercharge your skills and optimize your design library organization. 🚀Join us as we share some invaluable tips and tricks. By mastering effective library organization, you can streamline your workflow, enhance collaboration, and unlock your creative potential. 🌟🔍 Tip #1: Create two different files: one for styles and the other one for components.💡 Tip #2: The file with styles: create a page for colors, typographies and another one for icons.🌈 Tip #3: The file with components: separate pages for each component.🤝 Tip #4: In both files add a cover page and introduction or welcome guide and release notes or a changelog, this could help your team to follow up!📚 Tip #5: Continuous Learning: Expand your design systems knowledge by staying up-to-date with industry trends, attending workshops, and exploring relevant resources. Cultivating a growth mindset will propel your skills to new heights.Ready to transform your design systems organization? Don't miss out on this opportunity to optimize your workflow and boost your creative potential. Let's embark on this journey together!If you're eager to learn more about organizing your design library or want to explore other essential design system topics, feel free to connect with us. We're here to support your professional growth and help you achieve design excellence! 💪✨#DesignSystems #LibraryOrganization #CreativeExcellence #ProfessionalGrowth

name: Arnold Ma
content: 🤑 Guangdong alone = Mexico's GDP!Will China STILL be a strong economy in 15 years?👇 China: from a poor struggling nation, to the world’s economic powerhouse.It all started with the 改革开放 (or Reform & Opening up) - the policy that helped turn China into an economic miracle.10% growth rates were maintained for literally decades since the late 70s.In 2022, the 3 fastest growing provinces were Fujian & Jiangxi (4.7%).Nowadays, a single province (sometimes even city!) may *surpass* the GDP of a whole country abroad 😳 Switzerland < Sichuan  Sweden < Henan  There are several reasons, but these 3 played a big role: 【1】 Focus  Many small cities in China focused on contributing to + rapidly developing very specific industries. This also created new selling points to attract foreign investment. 【2】 Scale China’s own massive domestic market size (i.e. vast consumer base) is very self-sufficient + capable of generating significant economic growth. Lifting people out of poverty created a positive feedback loop 🙏 【3】Infrastructure By investing in high-speed rail systems, 5G networks, parks, real estate, etc. - the country grew better integrated, further boosting its productivity & growth. 🚨As remarkable as all of that is, it’s not all rainbows and sunshine... There is now a massive wealth inequality gap among income groups + urban/rural divide that was created as a result.  This has become the NEXT big challenge to tackle!  Do you think China will maintain its economic status? Which country/city will rise up next? 🤔Arnold Ma #China #economy #growth #business #success

name: Pablo Sánchez Arias
content: Boost Your R Code's Performance with parSapply 🚀Hey LinkedIn fam! 👋 Are you looking to supercharge your R code and make it run faster? 🏃‍♂️ Today, I want to share with you an amazing function in R called parSapply that can significantly speed up your computations. 💨parSapply is a parallel computing function in R that allows you to distribute computations across multiple cores or processors, harnessing the power of parallel processing. 🚀 By using parSapply, you can take advantage of the full processing power of your machine, making your code more efficient and saving you precious time ⌛.Here's a simple example of how parSapply can be used to speed up your code:```R# Load the parallel packagelibrary(parallel)# Define a function to be applied in parallelmy_function <- function(x) { # Perform some computationally intensive task # ...}# Create a vector of inputsmy_data <- 1:100# Apply the function in parallel using parSapplyresults <- parSapply(my_data, my_function)```In this example, parSapply distributes the computations of the `my_function` across multiple cores, processing each element of `my_data` simultaneously. This can lead to a significant speedup compared to the sequential version of the code.By leveraging parallel processing with parSapply, you can tackle computationally intensive tasks more efficiently, such as large-scale simulations, data processing, or complex calculations. 💪So, if you find yourself working with large datasets or performing repetitive calculations in R, give parSapply a try! It's a powerful tool that can make a noticeable difference in your code's performance. ⚡️If you're interested in learning more about optimizing your R code and unlocking its full potential, I highly recommend checking out DataCamp's course "Writing Efficient R Code" (link: [https://lnkd.in/dVwBqbAN]). It covers various techniques and best practices to improve the efficiency and speed of your R code.Remember, in today's data-driven world, every second counts when it comes to data analysis and processing. Stay ahead of the game by optimizing your R code with parSapply and other performance-enhancing techniques. Happy coding! 💻✨#RProgramming #DataScience #ParallelProcessing #EfficientCoding #DataCamp

name: Claude Loeffen
content: "Please don't prep the candidates for interviews".Have you ever been told this by a hiring manager? I have.  ❗"Over-preparation might make a candidate come across as rehearsed or not authentic"❗❗"If a candidate is not prepared for certain questions or situations, their response can provide insights into their problem-solving skills"❗While I respect their perspective I always highly recommend them to let us prepare candidates for their interviews.But how can you get them on your side? Just telling them that it highly improves the candidate experience is not enough.I see better results when pointing out the effect it could have on the "INTERVIEW-TEAM EXPERIENCE":1️⃣ Time Consuming: Unprepared candidates may need to have basic concepts or processes explained to them, which can extend the duration of the interview.2️⃣ Increased Frustration: Interviewers may become frustrated if they need to repeatedly clarify questions or concepts due to a candidate's lack of understanding.3️⃣ Lack of Engagement: An unprepared candidate is less likely to ask insightful questions or engage in meaningful conversation, resulting in a more monotonous interview experience.4️⃣ More Follow-Up Interviews: If a candidate is unprepared, it may necessitate further rounds of interviews, placing additional burdens on the interview team.5️⃣ Hindered Decision-Making: The lack of clarity and depth in an unprepared candidate's responses can make the hiring decision more challenging.6️⃣  Negative Perception: Continually dealing with unprepared candidates can lead to a negative perception of the recruitment process or the recruitment team involved.In the end, we want more than just to find people for jobs. We want to help skilled people and great companies find each other. We believe that getting candidates ready for interviews is a key step in doing this.In your opinion, what role should recruiters play in preparing candidates for interviews?#candidateexperience #interviewing #interviewpreparation #talentacquisition #hiringmanagers

name: Constanza Gil
content: Junto con mi equipo de Legal en Barcelona, estamos muy contentos de contar que la semana pasada nos ha llegado nuestra primera resolución favorable del nuevo permiso de residencia para NOMADAS DIGITALES. Luego de la entrada en vigor de la ultima modificación de Ley 14/2013, donde se introduce esta nueva figura legal, para aquellos ciudadanos de terceros países , fuera del ámbito de la Unión Europea,  que desarrollan su profesión de forma remota en España. Ha significado un gran trabajo personal de investigación y estudio para llegar finalmente a esta resolución, que espero sea la primera de muchas.Me parece de gran importancia que las leyes que nos rigen en nuestra vida cotidiana, comiencen a estar a la altura del mundo globalizado en el que vivimos y sin duda esta posibilidad de residir en España desarrollando la profesión de manera remota, es un gran avance 🌏 .

name: Apiux Tecnología
content: No todos se atreven a enfrentarse al cambio de rutina, a los dolores musculares después de un entrenamiento y a cruzar decenas de kilómetros por toda la ciudad. 🥵💛 ¡Pero nuestros #Yellowers sí! 💛Ayer 14 de Mayo, el equipo de Apiux Runner 2023 atravesó con éxito la línea de meta de la Maratón de Santiago, 🇨🇱 demostrando una vez más de qué estamos hechos. 🏃😎Fueron 2 meses y medio de preparación y entrenamientos semanales, guiados por nuestra coach Karen Torrealba, en las que el equipo fortaleció cuerpo y mente para afrontar este desafío. 🏆No fue fácil, pero nos encantan los retos. 🎯El deporte no solo ejercita el cuerpo, 🧍también ejercita la mente.🧠 ¡Gracias equipo Apiux Runner ‘23! 💛 ¡Nunca paren de avanzar!➡️¡We´re not comfortable by being comfortable! 🚀Aquí el resumen. ⬇️ ¡Ayúdanos a compartir nuestra experiencia! 🔄

name: Pablo Sánchez Arias
content: 📢 Boosting Your Data Manipulation Skills in R: The Power of ymd() 🚀Are you tired of dealing with messy date formats in your data? Look no further! Let me introduce you to the amazing `ymd()` function in R, which stands for "year-month-day."The `ymd()` function is part of the `lubridate` package, a powerful toolkit for handling dates and times in R. It allows you to effortlessly convert character strings representing dates into proper date objects, making your data manipulation tasks a breeze.Here's a quick example to illustrate the magic of `ymd()`:```Rlibrary(lubridate)# Convert character strings to date objectsdate_strings <- c("2023-05-15", "2023-06-20", "2023-07-10")dates <- ymd(date_strings)# Perform operations with datesearliest_date <- min(dates)latest_date <- max(dates)date_diff <- latest_date - earliest_date# Wow! Manipulating dates has never been easier with ymd()! 🎉```By using `ymd()`, you can directly convert date strings in the "yyyy-mm-dd" format to date objects without worrying about the specific formatting details. It intelligently recognizes the year, month, and day components, allowing you to focus on your analysis rather than spending time on data cleaning.So, whether you're working with time series data, conducting trend analysis, or simply need to extract specific components from dates, `ymd()` will be your new best friend.Ready to level up your data manipulation game in R? Explore the `ymd()` function from the `lubridate` package and unlock the full potential of your date-related tasks! 📅💪#DataManipulation #RProgramming #DateHandling #lubridate #ymdFunction

name: John Crickett
content: If I were to start my programming journey again, I would learn these three programming languages:1. Python2. TypeScript3. RustIn that order.Here’s why Python:Python has a comprehensive standard library that makes it easy to do most things with just the language itself. You can also just download the interpreter and go!Python is also easy to learn. Its simple syntax and readability make it an excellent choice for beginners, while still providing experienced programmers with the tools they need to tackle complex problems.Python is one of the most in-demand skills in the job market today. From data engineering and data scientist to software engineers, Python is used across a wide range of industries and applications.So if you're just starting out on your programming journey Python is a great fit.Here’s why TypeScript:TypeScript combines the benefits of JavaScript (and all of it’s useful ecosystem) with type-checking. This type-checking allows the compiler to catch many potential bugs at compile time rather than runtime.TypeScript is also easy to learn. Its relatively simple syntax and readability make it an excellent choice for junior to intermediate developers moving into their first typed programming language, while still providing the tools you need to tackle complex problems.TypeScript is also one of the most in-demand skills in the job market today - fourth on a recent survey behind Python and JavaScript (which it will probably overtake soon).Here’s why Rust:Rust straddles the line between application and systems programming language. As such it’s well suited to writing both applications and systems software. Being both a high level language and at the same time offering zero-cost abstractions and built in support for concurrency which allows us to write performant code.Rust has a number of features, i.e. immutable, by default, type safety and ownership that help detect or prevent common programming errors, i.e. memory errors, type errors and data races.Rust has a great and rapidly evolving ecosystem offering a wide range of crates and a great command line tool - cargo - to manage dependencies and builds.How about you?

name: Amazon
content: You know that exciting feeling you get when your Amazon package arrives? Well, it turns out you're not the only one that gets excited, your pets love it too! 💙 📦 That's why we are thrilled that our second Amazon Pet Day shopping event is in full swing, May 2nd-3rd.To help celebrate National Pet Month, we will also be donating to chosen organizations that focus on animal welfare, as well as providing free dog vaccinations at select locations while supplies last, in collaboration with PetIQ.  Drop us a comment below with a photo of your pet enjoying their Amazon delivery. 🐾 To learn more about Amazon Pet Day, read here ➡️ https://amzn.to/42hNob7
